Enumeration# NSControl.BorderShape

macOS 26.0+

```
enum BorderShape
```

## [Topics](/documentation/AppKit/NSControl/BorderShape#topics)

### [Enumeration Cases](/documentation/AppKit/NSControl/BorderShape#Enumeration-Cases)

[`case automatic`](/documentation/appkit/nscontrol/bordershape/automatic)The control will resolve this to an appropriate shape for the given control size and context[`case capsule`](/documentation/appkit/nscontrol/bordershape/capsule)The control will resolve this to an appropriate shape for the given control size and context[`case circle`](/documentation/appkit/nscontrol/bordershape/circle)The control will resolve this to an appropriate shape for the given control size and context[`case roundedRectangle`](/documentation/appkit/nscontrol/bordershape/roundedrectangle)The control will resolve this to an appropriate shape for the given control size and context### [Initializers](/documentation/AppKit/NSControl/BorderShape#Initializers)

tint prominence of the button. Use tint prominence to gently suggest a hierarchy when multiple buttons perform similar actions. A button with primary tint prominence suggests the most preferred option, while secondary prominence indicates a reasonable alternative. See [`NSTintProminence`](/documentation/appkit/nstintprominence) for a list of possible values.[`enum NSTintProminence`](/documentation/appkit/nstintprominence)Controls how strongly the tint color applies in a view.
